intro: Ankylobus cruciatus, commonly known as the cross-leafed ankylobus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, deeply lobed leaves that resemble a cross, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in shaded, woodland environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
